stanza.line: How heavy do I journey on the (a)way(/a)
When what I seek (my weary travel's (b)end)(/b)
Doth teach that case and that repose to (a)say(/a)
'Thus far the miles are measured from thy (b)friend'(/b)
The beast that bears me tired with my (c)woe(/c)
Plods dully on to bear that weight in (d)me(/d)
As if by some instinct the wretch did (c)know(/c)
His rider loved not speed being made from (d)thee(/d)
The bloody spur cannot provoke him (e)on(/e)
That sometimes anger thrusts into his (f)hide(/f)
Which heavily he answers with a (e)groan(/e)
More sharp to me than spurring to his (f)side(/f)
For that same groan doth put this in my (g)mind(/g)
My grief lies onward and my joy (g)behind(/g)
